title: formal non-connected script, presumably called El Dorado
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906231027im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/imagem_duvida%20_6113.jpg)

 [‹ Sheraton hotels -- typeface?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906231027/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41162 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) fat rounded stencil sans on T-shirt by Build - Beans {Mark S} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906231027/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34175 "Go to next forum topic")
author: alan lima

comments.content:
Hi Alan, where is this from? And how old is it?  
F

Hi Florian!  
I don’t know. I got this font in my University and some people don’t know it too. They call it “eldorado”.

<cite>formal non-connected script</cite>  
Aka ‘italic’?  
;°)

@ Alan:  
<cite>I got this font in my University</cite>  
As a digital font? Can you open it in a font management or editor application to view the copyright information?

\>\> _formal non-connected script_

\> Aka ‘italic’?

May I point out that in my not-so-humble opinion this sample bears more resemblance to a formal script than to an italic (for example the typical x-shape). :^P

I could be wrong, but until this gets identified and confirmed, I stand by my description.

Tsss, smartass… ;^)

Haha!  
I didn’t want to object to your description … What else is an italic than a certain ‘formal non-connected script’?  
I just had a look at Dwiggins’ Eldorado which Dan mentioned, or rather the homonymous revival by Berlow, Frere-Jones & Rickner. Yes, [its italic is quite different](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906231027/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/font_bureau/eldorado_text_italic/?sample_text=abcefgvwxy&sample_size=60&acs_p=1&acs_pt=24&acs=1), but at least the [italic (small) cap x has a cross-bar](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906231027/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/font_bureau/eldorado_text_italic_sc/?sample_text=abcefgvwxy%20X&sample_size=60), too.

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906231027im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/image_duvida_3_comp_4383.jpg)

Hola, I am showing again caracters of the font that I got in my university. I am researching a lot but I don’t see some similar font.  
Florian, this font isn’t a digital font. It’s a analogic typeface:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906231027im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/image_3_metal_6339.JPG)

Dan Reynolds, I visited the site [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Eldorado/styles](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906231027/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Eldorado/styles "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Eldorado/styles") and saw the ’similar’ font, but it’s not equal.

Thank all you. I will consider — formal non-connected script, presumably called El Dorado. I go on researching and who found out other informations, I would like to know

:)
